animals.name: Dolphin
animals.fact: Dolphins are super smart! They can recognize themselves in mirrors and have their own names. They use echolocation to 'see' with sound, sending out clicks that bounce off objects to help them navigate and find food.
animals.funFact: Dolphins sleep with one eye open!

animals.name: Elephant
animals.fact: Elephants never forget! They have amazing memories and can remember friends for many years. They're also the largest land animals and can communicate using sounds too low for humans to hear.
animals.funFact: Elephants can smell water from 3 miles away!

animals.name: Penguin
animals.fact: Penguins can't fly, but they are amazing swimmers! They can dive deep into the ocean and hold their breath for up to 20 minutes. They also huddle together to stay warm in freezing temperatures.
animals.funFact: Penguins can jump 6 feet out of the water!

animals.name: Butterfly
animals.fact: Butterflies taste with their feet! They have taste sensors on their feet to find food. They can see ultraviolet light and migrate thousands of miles. Some butterflies can fly up to 30 miles per hour!
animals.funFact: Butterflies have four wings, not two!

animals.name: Octopus
animals.fact: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood! They are also super smart and can solve puzzles. They can change color and texture to blend in with their surroundings, making them amazing at hiding.
animals.diet: Crabs, fish, and other sea creatures
animals.funFact: Octopuses have 9 brains - one central brain and 8 mini-brains in each arm!

animals.name: Giraffe
animals.fact: Giraffes have super long necks! They only need to sleep for about 30 minutes a day, usually in short naps. Their long necks help them reach leaves high up in trees that other animals can't reach.
animals.funFact: A giraffe's tongue is 20 inches long and is blue-black in color!

animals.name: Polar Bear
animals.fact: Polar bears are the largest land carnivores! They have black skin under their white fur to absorb heat from the sun. They're excellent swimmers and can swim for days without stopping.
animals.funFact: Polar bears can smell a seal from 20 miles away!

animals.name: Kangaroo
animals.fact: Kangaroos can't walk backwards! They hop on their powerful hind legs and use their tail for balance. Baby kangaroos, called joeys, live in their mother's pouch for about 6 months.
animals.funFact: Kangaroos can jump up to 30 feet in one leap!

animals.name: Tiger
animals.fact: Tigers are the largest cats in the world! Each tiger has unique stripes, just like human fingerprints. They're excellent swimmers and love water, unlike most cats. Tigers can run up to 40 miles per hour!
animals.diet: Deer, wild boar, and other animals
animals.funFact: A tiger's roar can be heard from 2 miles away!
